definition: to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: He bellows, rends the air with anguish.
sentences.chinese: 他咆哮着，痛苦的喊聲劃破長空。

sentences.english: Scarify a piece of white paper by snails.
The beautiful mark in the blue sky, as well as in my memory.
sentences.chinese: 飛機劃破藍空，也在我的記憶中留下印痕。

sentences.english: The ankle must be lacerated by some kind of plant.
sentences.chinese: 腳踝一定是被某種植物劃破了。

sentences.english: His forefinger was cut by knife and bled a lot.
sentences.chinese: 他的示指被刀劃破了，流了很多血。

sentences.english: When you clean off the slate, take care not to break it.
sentences.chinese: 在帶保險套時小心不要被手指甲劃破。

sentences.english: A plane sheard the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 一架飛機劃破藍天而過。

sentences.english: Countle meteoroids will be sent hurtling into the Earth's atmo here at 71 kilometres a second.
sentences.chinese: 無數流星將以每秒71公里的速度劃破長空。

sentences.english: Jane fell off the bike, cutting her leg.
sentences.chinese: 簡從自行車上摔下，劃破了腿。

sentences.english: "DaDa" footsteps suddenly cut the original silence.
sentences.chinese: “噠噠”的腳步聲忽然劃破了原有的沉寂。

sentences.english: I will gask the lucifer's chest.
E. g. 1) How did you cut your thumb?
sentences.chinese: 你的拇指是怎麼劃破的？

sentences.english: A sudden howl pierced the silence.
sentences.chinese: 突然一聲嗥叫劃破了寂靜。

sentences.english: The sky, deepening to ochre, is broken by two or three seagulls.
sentences.chinese: 兩點三點白鷗劃破了漸變爲赭色的天空。

sentences.english: Almost at the same moment a piercing female cry arose in the air in a prolonged shriek.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎同時一個女人淒厲的尖叫聲劃破長空。

sentences.english: On a clear night scores of meteors streak the sky.
sentences.chinese: 在晴朗的夜晚，好幾十顆流星劃破長空。

definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
wordless and uncommunicative (idiom); without speaking/taciturn/not providing any news
to push aside/to part/to brush away
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
